intro: Hedyotis pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited pennywort, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
